title: internet/ lol client problem  - lower priority que help
body:
I was playing a ranked game we have ok internet, like I can play lol and my little sister can be on Netflix and I have like 80 ping, but I can play with that, but sometimes just randomly my ping hits the 1000, 2000 or 3000,

 and I have tried turning off the modem and then Turing it on again, ive lowering my graphics to lower my ping and  the only way that has worked is to quit and try to reconnect back into the  league game. but sometimes when I reconnect  the league client pops up but it stays black and doesn't do anything so I use task manager to quit that and reconnect again, but it is still black. so I am forced to quit the lol game and the client.

 I finally reconnect to the game at playing level and we lost that game, but after I got a lower priority que for leaving but that is the only way that has worked to get back into my game. and I have been put in like 3 or 4 20 min wait lower priority que because of my internet/ lol client problem and I'm afraid that I might get a permanent ban and I have spent like over $400 over the 4 to 5 years playing the amazing game.

so plz riot is there a way to help me, is there a way to fix this problem I love this game, ive spent like $400 or more on this game  and I don't want to lose the money and the game   :'(  {{item:3070}} 

p.s is there a way to reset my lower priority que  because I have been literally forced to quit the game due to my problem  , so I can get back to playing the game
plz help

replies.body:
Hey DreamStealer99,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

thank you for some solutions, 

1. net time I have the lagging problem ill try disabling my firewall, or disabling ivp6 and ill also try the rest
2.  we are using unlimited optus internet (is that ISP (Internet Service Provider))
3. my region and state are QLD and Sunshine Coast area
4. I tried and failed bu to got this

 Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.10586]
(c) 2015 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

C:\Users\user>(tracert 103.240.227.5) > "%USERPROFILE%\desktop\Tracert.txt"

C:\Users\user>or
'or' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

C:\Users\user>
C:\Users\user>
C:\Users\user>
C:\Users\user>

(I couldn't find the insert button)

5. these issues don't happen often but like once in every 4 to 5 games 
6. if this happened is there any way do quit lol and then get back in lol to reconnect without the lower priority que 
also league is awesome

oh wait I found the tracer file.. I still cant find the insert button so I will copy and paste.

I hope this helps btw is there anything you guys could do about my lower priority que 
I have an idea if when someone quits lol it should go through this program that tests the internet speed of the player and if the internet connection with the OCE servers is running slow on like above 500 ping you don't get punished with lower priority que
It appears that your router is fine; however, your ISP is having issues. You may want to contact your ISP to see if they can resolve this issue.
